page.title: 14FARMING_SILAGE MAKING
page.content: In the Llangadog area farmers make silage for winter feeding for their dairy herds. Silage is made this way. In June the grass is cut.It is left on the ground for a short while to wilt and then the forage harvester comes along, picks up the grass with its spikes,cuts it into little shreds and then blows it into a big trailer that is pulled behind it.The full trailer load is then unloaded at the silo pit back at the farm where a tractor with a buckrake pushes the grass into the pit.The tractor then drives over it to roll it tight so that the juice runs out.More and more grass is piled on top. When the pit is full it is covered with a plastic sheet to keep the air out.Heavy weights are put on top and it is left for a few months until needed for winter feeding for the cattle.
